This is an example app to demonstrate the design of a Privacy Friendly App. Further explanations can be found in the Privacy Friendly App Guide.

There are multiple ways to display basic buttons. Button 1 is the basic button. If you wish to separate a button visually, use button 2. The buttons 3–5 are examples for highlighted buttons. Depending on the app other colors are possible.
Use the button in the lower left corner to call the Welcome Dialog.
This is the default main menu for game apps. The viewpager above should be used to switch between game modes.
Privacy Friendly Ludo is a boardgame.
How many Players can play the Game?
On the small gamefield it is possible to play with up to 4 players. On the big gamefield with up to 6 players.
Privacy Friendly Ludo does not require any permission. It further does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisement.
What are the rules of Privacy Friendly Ludo?
Rolling a six means that you have to set a figure from home field (start position) to the colored start field.
If the start field is occupied, you have to make it free as soon as possible.
Are no more figures on the home field and a six was rolled all other figures can be used. Also the startfield has not to be free.
If the target field of a figure is occupied by an opponent figure, the opponent figure will be beaten and send back to the home field.

If the target field of a figure is occupied by another figure of the same player, the turn is not allowed. Therefore another figure will be chosen or the turn will be finished without moving a figure.
It is the choice of the recent player which allowed figure he wants to move. The dice number cannot be spreaded on more than one figure.

In the 4 endfields of each player there exists 2 special rules. First: It is not allowed to jump over other figures in the endfield. Second: You can only roll dice once if a figure is on the endfield but not in the goal position.

This app is a boardgame for 1–6 players.
There are 2 different gamefields. One with up to 4 players and one with up to 6 players. Started games can be saved.
The rules are explained in the help section. Additionally it is possible to play the game with own rules by choosing a figure and selecting the target field. This mode is called "play with own dice".
The color and name of the players can be free chosen. Additionally it can be chosen if a computer is the opponent.

To play with own dice means that the figure will be marked if you click on it and set to the clicked goalfield. Therefore playing a game with own rules and an external dice is possible.
To play with computer, you have to deactivate the \"use own dice mode\".
